newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR WEAKENS FURTHER AGAINST KEY UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR WEAKENS FURTHER AGAINST KEY UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed on Wednesday weaker against major units, pressured by strong demand for foreign currency with scarce export resources to support it, dealers said.

"The (Zimbabwean) dollar continued to slide due to import pressure and there was no sign of the (central) Reserve Bank. I believe the authorities that be are happy to see it go down," one dealer said.

The local unit finished Wednesday's session at 10.0450/0650 on the U.S. dollar, down from its overnight 10.0300/0500 and was at 15.5620/6020 from 15.4950/5370 versus sterling, partly in response to the British currency's strength against the U.S. dollar abroad.
It also closed weaker at 6.7740/7890 against the mark compared to Tuesday's 6.7260/7410 and was at 2.2000/2070 from 2.1940/2010 against the rand.
